ROW.SRNA_NOTE: SgrS was found to regulate the translation of manX by facilitating the interaction of Hfq with a site near the ribosome binding site, which then inhibits initiation of translation |CITS: [29294046]|.
RNase E and Hfq are required for RyhB-induced degradation of the msrB mRNA |CITS: [23671689]|.
Hfq binding at the 5' end of the mRNA might remodel the 5' UTR to enable binding of CpxQ |CITS: [31308070]|.
Hfq is required for mRNA decay initiated by CyaR; here, the requirement for Hfq is not due to stabilization of CyaR. Hfq binds to an A/U-rich motif in the 5' UTR of hdeD |CITS: [29294085]|.

RyhB interaction with the iscRSUA mRNA at a site between the iscR and iscS open reading frames leads to cleavage of the mRNA and subsequent degradation of the 3' iscSUA mRNA, while the IscR-encoding 5' end of the mRNA remains stable |CITS: [19407815]|.

Site-directed mutagenesis of both the GcvB small RNA and the regulatory region of sstT have been
performed, but a precise binding region has not been defined |CITS: [18952787]|.
RyhB induces RNase E-dependent degradation of the mRNA |CITS: [22474262]|.

Here, Spot 42 RNA appears to recruit Hfq binding to a site overlapping the ribosome binding site, thereby inhibiting binding of the 30S subunit of the ribosome and initiation of translation |CITS: [22474262]|.
SgrS stabilizes the yigL mRNA by blocking RNase E from scanning the mRNA for a cleavage site downstream of the SgrS binding site |CITS: [30852060]|.

The GlmZ small RNA binds to the upstream UTR of glmS, prohibiting formation of a secondary
structure that occludes the ribosome binding site, thus allowing translation |CITS: [18351803]|.

Hfq facilitates base pairing between SgrS and manY mRNA |CITS: [32291821]|.
Rbosomal protein S1 binding to this site enhances translation of manY; SgrS binding interferes with binding of S1 and thereby downregulates translation |CITS: [32291821]|.
Binding of RybC protects cfa mRNA from RNase E cleavage |CITS: [31308070]|.

Regulation of GalK expression by Spot 42 at this site occurs after RNase cleavage of mRNAs transcribed from the galE promoter, which generates the so-called mK2 mRNA with a new 5' end. Binding of Spot 42 leads to degradation of mK2 |CITS: [26045496]|.
DicF was found to regulate the translation of manX by facilitating the interaction of Hfq with a site near the ribosome binding site, which then inhibits initiation of translation |CITS: [29294046]|.
Binding of RybC protects cfa mRNA from RNase E cleavage |CITS: [31308070]|.
Hfq binding at the 5' end of the mRNA might remodel the 5' UTR to enable binding of CpxQ |CITS: [31308070]|.

While its interaction with Hfq is strong, OxyS only shows weak affinity for the rpoS leader region. Thus, regulation of rpoS translation by OxyS may be due to sequestration of Hfq rather than by binding to rpoS mRNA |CITS: [21889623][22040174]|.
Stimulation of translation by ArcZ is dependent on Hfq binding to the rpoS mRNA leader region |CITS: [20457943]|.
RybB induces RNase E-dependent degradation of the mRNA |CITS: [22474262]|.
This SgrS binding site (site II) improves repression of asd expression in combination with the upstream SgrS binding site (site I) |CITS: [31340077]|.
In a deaD mutant strain, DsrA-rpoS duplex formation does not occur |CITS: [21045550]|.
Hfq is required for mRNA decay initiated by CyaR; here, the requirement for Hfq is not due to stabilization of CyaR. Hfq binds to an A/U-rich motif in the 5' UTR of hdeD |CITS: [29294085]|.
Binding of Hfq blocks translation initiation; binding of RyhB leads to changes in the mRNA secondary structure, thereby displacing Hfq |CITS: [24065131]|.
RNase E and Hfq are required for RyhB-induced degradation of the msrB mRNA |CITS: [23671689]|.

Glucose increases Hfq protein levels, which decreases ompA mRNA stability, with a half-life of ~11.5 to ~8.1 min. On the other hand, in the absence of glucose, cAMP represses hfq and thereby stabilizes ompA mRNA |CITS:[21840983]|.
In an ohsC deletion mutant, expression of ShoB is more than two-fold higher under all tested conditions |CITS: [18710431]|.
